definition: to ally/to unite/to join/(poetry) antithetical couplet

sentences.english: A Confederate boat carried Fox to Sumter.
sentences.chinese: 一艘邦联的船只将福克斯运送到萨姆特堡。

sentences.english: Before that, China was a confederation of states, called "the middle kingdoms".
sentences.chinese: 统一之前，中国是诸侯国的邦联，叫做“中央王国”。

sentences.english: The show features a sports car with the Confederate battle flag painted on top.
sentences.chinese: 该剧以一台喷涂了邦联战旗的跑车为特色。

sentences.english: A year later, the Empire expressed interest in the powerful warriors of the Calian Confederacy.
sentences.chinese: 一年后，帝国看中了强大的卡利安邦联勇士。

sentences.english: The defeated Confederate army lost 23, 231 soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 邦联败军则损失了23231名士兵。

sentences.english: The Confederate point of view swings back and forth from Lee to Longstreet.
sentences.chinese: 邦联的角度来看来回摆动从李登辉朗斯特里特。

sentences.english: Yuan Gao, Virginia Commonwealth University, USA.
sentences.chinese: 高原教授，弗吉尼亚州立邦联大学，美国。

sentences.english: A group of Confederate riflemen fire their muskets.
sentences.chinese: 一个邦联步枪开火的步枪。

sentences.english: Instead they left the Union to form their own separate republic.
sentences.chinese: 他们离开了联盟组建了独立的邦联共和国。

definition: native state (term used by British Colonial power to refer to independent states of India or Africa)

pinyin: Ai4 er3 lan2 Gong4 he2 guo2
